Articles.Content:
I have only recently noticed the existence of GameEvents. I would like some descriptions of exactly when each of the events it contains fire. These are the events:

  • onCollision
  • onCrash
  • onCrashSplashdown
  • onCrewBoardVessel
  • onCrewKilled
  • onCrewOnEva
  • onDominantBodyChange
  • onFlagSelect
  • onFlightReady
  • onGamePause
  • onGameSceneLoadRequested
  • onGameStateCreated
  • onGameStateSaved
  • onGameUnpause
  • onJointBreak
  • onLaunch
  • onMissionFlagSelect
  • onOverheat
  • onPartAttach
  • onPartCouple
  • onPartDestroy
  • onPartRemove
  • onPartUndock
  • onPlanetariumTargetChanged
  • onSplashDamage
  • onStageActivate
  • onStageSeparation
  • onTimeWarpRateChanged
  • onUndock
  • onVesselChange
  • onVesselCreate
  • onVesselDestroy
  • onVesselGoOffRails
  • onVesselGoOnRails
  • onVesselLoaded
  • onVesselRename
  • onVesselSituationChange
  • onVesselWasModified

They all look extremely useful. But they need some clarification, e.g. does onVesselChange occur whenever the structure of the vessel (i.e. the hierarchy of parts) changes? Or is that for the VAB/SPH only?
All the Vessel events are likely things that occur in the flight space, OnVesselChange being when you [ ] between ships
